argument.name: Result
argument.description: .T. if variable exists, and .F. if it does not exist

argument.name: variableName
argument.description: A string or string expression containing the name of a variable

page.description: Return true if a variable exists.
page.discussion: Previously, developers have used the eval_valid function in Xbasic code to test if a variable exists. Eval_valid() is a relatively expensive function to execute. In situations where there are a large number of calls to eval_valid(), the time taken by eval_valid() can become noticeable. As a result, a new function variable_exists() has been created specifically to test if a variable exists. Contrast eval_valid(), which tests if an entire expression is valid (for example: eval_valid("firstname + lastname") ), with variable_exists(), which merely tests if a variable exists or not. When the 'expression' tested by eval_valid() is simple (e.g. "Firstname"), then eval_valid() is functionally equivalent to variable_exists(). Note: variable_exists() is much faster than eval_valid() when testing Session variables and .NET variables, but only slightly faster than eval_valid() when testing ordinary Xbasic variables.
page.example:
dim arr[1] as p arr[1].foo.bar = "hello" ? variable_exists["arr[1].foo.bar"] = .T.
indx = 1 ? variable_exists["arr["+indx+"].foo.bar"] = .T.
? variable_exists["arr[indx].foo.bar"] = .T.
indx = 2 ? variable_exists["arr["+indx+"].foo.bar"] = .F.
? variable_exists["arr[indx].foo.bar"] = .F.
'Forms can't be tested directly with this function, ' but there are two alternatives
'This form exists in AlphaSports p = form.load["arr["]
?Customer_Information.window_title = "].foo.bar"
'Variable_exists() cannot be used on certain Alpha Five desktop objects, ' such as forms
?variable_exists["arr[indx].foo.bar"] = .F.
'Note that eval_valid() for the same argument is .t. ?eval_valid["arr[indx].foo.bar"] = .T.
'On the other hand if we test p.window_title (since p is an ordinary xbasic variable), ' variable_exists() can be used ? variable_exists["customer information"] = .T.
